serverSession

Summary
Server sessions are used in place of the Virtual Http Session. This allow for a user session to be served by multiple web server machines. The session is created as early as possible, even before the user actually logs in.


Fields
Name Type Attributes Description
active  boolean required
  		This indicates if the session is currently active, or if it has expired.  
auditLogTitle  calculated
max length: 1000
allows all 		abstract
  		This is used a the title in auditLogs. This should NEVER be null.  
closedLocalDate  date abstract
  		The closed date based on the user's local timezone.  
closedLocalTime  time abstract
  		The closed time of day based on the user's local timezone.  
closedLocalTs  timestamp abstract
  		The closed timestamp converted to the user's local timezone.  
closedLocalTsMessage  text100
max length: 100
allows printable 		abstract
  		The closed timestamp converted to the user's local timezone, and formatted as a string that includes the timezone code.  
closedUtcTs  timestamp   The date and time when the session was closed.  
createdLocalDate  date abstract
  		The created date based on the user's local timezone.  
createdLocalTime  time abstract
  		The created time of day based on the user's local timezone.  
createdLocalTs  timestamp abstract
  		The created timestamp converted to the user's local timezone.  
createdLocalTsMessage  text100
max length: 100
allows printable 		abstract
  		The created timestamp converted to the user's local timezone, and formatted as a string that includes the timezone code.  
createdUtcTs  timestamp required
  		The date and time when the session was created.  
domainSubtitle  calculated
max length: 1000
allows all 		abstract
  		The subtitle commonly used for rows in a list. This MAY be null, if there is not subtitle.  
domainTitle  calculated
max length: 1000
allows all 		abstract
  		The title commonly used for rows in a list or dropdown field. This should NEVER be null.  
lastTouchedLocalDate  date abstract
  		The last touched date based on the user's local timezone.  
lastTouchedLocalTime  time abstract
  		The last touched time of day based on the user's local timezone.  
lastTouchedLocalTs  timestamp abstract
  		The last touched timestamp converted to the user's local timezone.  
lastTouchedLocalTsMessage  text100
max length: 100
allows printable 		abstract
  		The last touched timestamp converted to the user's local timezone, and formatted as a string that includes the timezone code.  
lastTouchedUtcTs  timestamp required
  		The time when the session was last touched. Used to support automatic timeouts.  
lockVersion  lockVersion required
audit disabled   		This is used to coordinate optimistic locking in the database. This is usually not displayed.  
uid  uid
max length: 30
allows printable 		primary key
required
  		The global unique key. This is a large hex-encoded number, and is usually not displayed to users. This is currently NOT a standard format, but is instead a format that we use internally.  
version  name
max length: 50
allows printable 		required
  		The application version. The server session is only valid if its version matches the application's current version. This is used to catch stale sessions when the application is upgraded.  


Associations
Name Type Attributes Description
autoLogin  autoLogin   The token, if any, that was used to automatically login.  
tenant  tenant required
  		The tenant.  
user  user   The user associated with this session.

Name Type Comment
